thread.title: 4th Impact, Lyons qualify for next round on ‘X Factor UK’
thread.title_full: 4th Impact, Lyons qualify for next round on ‘X Factor UK’ | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Jonathan M. Hicap
title: 4th Impact, Lyons qualify for next round on ‘X Factor UK’
text:
by Jonathan M. Hicap
October 1, 2015 4th IMPACT performing on the ‘X Factor UK’ Bootcamp (Photo by RTL CBS Entertainment/X Factor UK)
Two Filipino acts competing on the British TV singing contest “X Factor UK” have passed recent hurdles.
4th Impact, formerly known as 4th Power, is composed of sisters Mylene, Celina, Irene and Almira Cercado. They performed David Guetta’s hit “Titanium” on the show’s Bootcamp, complete with choreography.
Host Olly Murs said, “That’s an audition.”
Judge Simon Cowell commented the performance “wasn’t as strong as their other two (auditions)” but said he would love to work with them.
4th Impact performed Jessie J’s “Bang Bang” during their first audition.
A video of the performance has since gone viral, accumulating some 15 million views on the official YouTube channel of “X Factor UK” in the last four weeks.
With their performance, 4th Impact will now move on to the Six Chair Challenge that will start next week.
The Six Chair Challenge will cut the number of qualifiers in the Girls, Boys, Overs, and Groups categories to just six acts each.
Another Filipino, Neneth Lyons, the 37-year old full-time mom from Chelmsford, also made it to the Six Chair Challenge on the Overs category.
